intro: Chaetogastra gracilis var. longisetosa, commonly known as the long-hairy slender chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
